title: The Covenant of Circumcision
summary: In Genesis 17, God reaffirms His covenant with Abram, changes his name to Abraham, and institutes circumcision as the sign of the covenant. Sarai's name is also changed to Sarah, and God promises that she will bear a son.

faq.question: Why was Abram’s name changed to Abraham?
faq.answer: To reflect his new identity as the 'father of many nations.'

faq.question: What is the significance of circumcision?
faq.answer: It was the physical sign of God’s covenant with Abraham and his descendants.
